name: Dwarf Guilds
background:
Dwarves are short humanoids, united under the banner of a conglomerate of mega-companies. Their armies are made up of slow warriors with powerful weaponry, which rely on having a solid long-term plan to make up for their low mobility. 

The Dwarf Guilds rapidly expanded outwards from their home world, hoping to claim ever more of the galaxy’s resources. These ambitions eventually resulted in them starting a war that they could not win. Desperation led them to activate a machine that would end up destroying much of the Sirius Sector. Now the scattered survivors seek to rebuild with the same ambition of their predecessors.
backgroundFull:
The Dwarves originated on a mineral rich but inhospitable world. In order to escape the harsh conditions of the surface, their civilization developed underground where conditions were more stable. As their civilization continued to grow, they started to discover and innovate new uses for the ores and resources they uncovered as they dug their cities. Guilds of miners arose to stake claims on these ores, and soon, Guild Lords became the richest and most powerful Dwarves on their planets, holding absolute control of the ore which their society depended on.

The Guilds were driven by a demand for constant growth and competition with rival Guilds, causing them to mine ever deeper into their home world’s crust. The Guilds continued until they had stripped their world nearly bare, before turning toward space. They expanded rapidly outwards, their wealth grew as Guilds competed to stake claims over new systems. 

This rapid expansion only slowed when the Dwarves began to encounter more powerful factions. After some initial tension, the Dwarves struck up an alliance with the Elves. The Elves conceded a number of border worlds to the Dwarves while trade between the factions of Sirius flourished. Noticing the disunity of the Orcs, the Guilds used a Orc raids as a pretext to begin expanding into their territory.

After their initial success, the Guilds became more ambitious and began to expand deep into Orc territory. The Orcs united against them and quickly began to turn the tide. The Dwarves became desperate to recover what resources as they retreated, stripping many planets bare. Dwarves became increasingly desperate for resources and sought to create a wormhole that would allow them to rapidly extract resources from distant worlds, even other galaxies. 

When they activated their machine, something went terribly wrong. The Radiance Cascade tore through much of Sirius in an instant, destroying most of their worlds and killing most of those residing in Guild territory. The survivors were largely miners working on systems at the edge of their space. Following the Cascade, the Guilds moved quickly to evacuate survivors and adapt to a space born life. 

Most Dwarves now live on mobile mining fleets. These fleets travel through their territory extracting everything they can from a system before abandoning it. The Dwarves have also taken an interest in the Zone, contending that they have exclusive rights of salvage there.

How will you extract your fortune from the Sirius Sector?

spells.name: Battle Rune
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets +6" range when shooting once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getWeaponCostDiff(this.avgRangedWeapon, { quality: 4 }, ruleName, { range: this.avgRangedWeapon.range + params.effect.rangeModifier.value })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Breaking Rune
spells.effect: Pick one enemy model within 24", which takes 1 hit with AP(4).

spells.name: Armor Rune
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Sturdy Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Smiting Rune
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 4 hit with AP(1) and Quake.

spells.name: Deceleration Rune
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 18", which moves -2" when using Advance actions and -4" when using Rush/Charge actions once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? this.getSpeed(unit, { advance: params.effect.advanceSpeed.value, rush: params.effect.rushSpeed.value }) : 0

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getSpeed(this.AverageUnit, { advance: params.effect.advanceSpeed.value, rush: params.effect.rushSpeed.value })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Cleaving Rune
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which takes 3 hit with Blast(3).

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Stealth Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Stealth.

specialRules.name: Sturdy
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot or charged from over 9" away, they get +1 to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Swift
specialRules.description: This model may ignore the Slow rule.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Infiltrate Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Infiltrate.

specialRules.name: Infiltrate
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, but may be deployed up to 1" away from enemy units.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Mend
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one friendly model within 3" with Tough, and remove D3 wounds from it.

specialRules.name: Quake when Shooting
specialRules.description: This model gets Quake when shooting.

specialRules.name: Quake
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Swift Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Swift.

specialRules.name: Increased Shooting Range Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get +6" range when shooting.

specialRules.name: Devastating Frenzy
specialRules.description: Place one marker on this unit when it fully destroys an enemy unit. For each marker all models with this rule in this unit get AP(+1) and +1 to defense rolls until the end of the game (up to a max. of +2).

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unpredictable Fighter.

specialRules.name: Regeneration Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Surge when Shooting
specialRules.description: This model gets Surge when shooting.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover when Shooting
specialRules.description: This model gets Ignores Cover when shooting.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Sturdy Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Sturdy Boost.

specialRules.name: Re-Position Artillery
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one friendly model within 6" with Artillery, which may immediately move by up to 9".

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Ignores Cover when shooting.

specialRules.name: Speed Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which moves -2" when using Advance actions and -4" when using Rush/Charge actions once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Stealth
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Slow
specialRules.description: Moves -2" when using Advance, and -4” when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Sturdy Boost
specialRules.description: If all models in this unit have Sturdy, they always get +1 to defense rolls from Sturdy (instead of only when being shot/charged from over 9" away).

specialRules.name: Artillery
specialRules.description: May only use Hold actions. When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, it gets +1 to hit rolls. When enemy units shoot at this model from over 9" away, they get -2 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as models in the target unit.
